org.modelio.api.ui.form

Class ElementFormPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.ui.form.ElementFormPanel

  • public class ElementFormPanel
extends java.lang.Object
    An IPanelProvider implementation displaying a form for the selected model element.

    Forms are build using an IFieldFactory, and may be split into several pages. See FormFieldPage.

    Usage:
    1. make a subclass of AbstractFieldFactory,
    2. implement IFieldFactory.createFields(FormToolkit, Composite, ModelElement, FormFieldPage) and IFieldFactory.createFieldPages(ModelElement)
    3. Instantiate a panel with ElementFormPanel(IModuleContext, IFieldFactory).
    4. call createPanel(Composite)

    By default the model is updated immediately when a field is changed. Since Modelio Valkyrie 3.8 This behavior may be disabled with setAutoApply(boolean) .
    Panels listeners are always fired with the changed IField as 'data' when a field value changes.

    See Also:
    FormFieldPage, AbstractFieldFactory

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementFormPanel

        public ElementFormPanel(IModuleContext moduleContext,
                        IFieldFactory fieldFactory)
        Build a new instance of ElementFormPanel.

        The fields will apply their value immediately on leaving.

        Parameters:
        moduleContext - a module context to get modelio services and sessuin from.
        fieldFactory - the factory to create form fields with.
        Since:
        3.8 : a module context is now needed.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(IPanelListener l)

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Save all fields to the model.

        To be used when setAutoApply(boolean) was called with false.

        May throw a runtime exception if one field has an invalid value.

        Since:
        3.8 Valkyrie

      • canApply

        public boolean canApply()
        Tells whether apply() may be called safely.
        Returns:
        true only if all fields have valid values.
        Since:
        3.8 Valkyrie

      • setAutoApply

        public ElementFormPanel setAutoApply(boolean autoApply)
        Set whether the field will apply their value when leaving it.

        If called with false apply() must be called in order to apply the field values.

        Parameters:
        autoApply - true to apply values immediately, false to manually apply them.
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setHeaderVisible

        public void setHeaderVisible(boolean headerVisible)
        Display or hide the form header to display the edited element name or gain place.
        Parameters:
        headerVisible - whether the form header is displayed.
        Since:
        3.7.1

      • setInput

        public final void setInput(java.lang.Object input)
        Set the panel input.

        Supported inputs are:

        • a ModelElement
        • a Collection containing one ModelElement
        • a IStructuredSelection containing one ModelElement
        If the model element is not valid (deleted) or not relevant for the field provider the panel is emptied.

        Since Modelio 3.8 passing any other input type will result in IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

      • createFormFields

        protected void createFormFields(Composite parent,
                                ModelElement formInput)
        Create a complete form for an element.

        Fields should be filled after calling this method.

        Parameters:
        parent - a widget which will be the parent of the new field instance (cannot be null)
        formInput - the element to build the form for.

      • ensureFieldLayout

        protected void ensureFieldLayout(IField aField)
        Ensure the field has a GridData as layout data, creating one in the orher case.
        Parameters:
        aField - a form field

      • onModelChanged

        protected void onModelChanged(IModelingSession session,
                              IModelChangeEvent event)
        IModelChangeListener callback called on model change event.

        Refresh and reset fields from the model. This method could be redefined by sub classes.

        Parameters:
        session - the modeling session
        event - the event.
